short_summary: Replacements of wood framed foundation for a one-storey home in Val Marie, SK
description: Replacements of wood framed foundation for a one-storey home in Val Marie, SK
full_summary:
### Staff Housing Wood Foundation Replacement
#### Grasslands National Park

**Tender Reference:** cb-234-94716264

**Last Amended:** 2023-10-11

**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0187/A

**Publication Date:** 2023-09-28

**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-10-11T16:00:00

**Contracting Authority:** Parks Canada

**Contact Information:**

* Name: Annik Piché
* Email: annik.piche@pc.gc.ca
* Phone: (581) 398-3489

**Tender Description:**

The proposed work involves the replacement of a wood-framed foundation for a one-story home in Val Marie, Saskatchewan. 

**Work Details:**

* The estimated project value is between $100,001 > $250,000
* Non-compliance with the National Park Act regulations will not be tolerated
* Bidders must submit their bids by fax or email, as specified in the tender documents

**Site Visit:**

* A site visit will be held at Grasslands National Park Visitor Centre parking lot on October 3, 2023, at 13:30 Saskatchewan time
* Bidders must confirm their attendance along with the representative(s) attending the site visit 24 hours prior to the visit
* Failure to confirm will result in barred access to the site

**Tender Evaluation:**

* Bids will be evaluated based on the lowest price
* Details on the bidding process can be found in the tender documents

**Technical and Contractual Enquiries:**

* Enquiries must be submitted to the Contracting Authority by email: annik.piche@pc.gc.ca
* The Contracting Authority will respond to enquiries within five business days of receipt
* Enquiries received after the set timeline may not be responded to

**Tender Documents:**

* Can be accessed on the Government of Canada tendering service at http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities
* Addenda, when issued, will also be available

**Language:**

* The tender documents are available in both English and French
* Bidders must ensure they submit their bid in either one of these two languages

By submitting a bid, the bidder certifies that they have read, understand and agree to the terms and conditions outlined in the tender documents.

Please refer to the tender documents for more information.

---
